text: {{Infobox officeholder | name = Lucas Papademos | image = LucasPapademos.jpg | office = Prime Minister of Greece | president = Karolos Papoulias | deputy = Theodoros Pangalos | term_start = 11 November 2011 | term_end = 16 May 2012 | predecessor = George Papandreou | successor = Panagiotis Pikrammenos | office1 = Vice President of the European Central Bank | president1 = Wim Duisenberg Jean-Claude Trichet | term_start1 = 31 May 2002 | term_end1 = 31 May 2010 | predecessor1 = Christian Noyer | successor1 = Vítor Constâncio | office2 = Governor of the Bank of Greece | deputy2 = Panagiotis Thomopoulos | term_start2 = 26 October 1994 | term_end2 = 31 May 2002 | predecessor2 = Ioannis Boutos | successor2 = Nikolaos Garganas | birth_name = Lucas Demetrios Papademos | birth_date = | birth_place = Athens, Greece | death_date = | death_place = | party = Independent | spouse = Shanna Ingram | education = Massachusetts Institute of Technology | signature = Accession Treaty 2011 Lucas Papademos signature.svg | caption = Papademos in 2012 | native_name = }} Lucas Demetrios Papademos (; born 11 October 1947) is a Greek economist. He was Prime Minister of Greece from November 2011 to May 2012. He was Vice President of the European Central Bank from 2002 to 2010 and Governor of the Bank of Greece from 1994 to 2002. He was a Visiting Professor of Public Policy at the Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University and is a Senior Fellow at the Center for Financial Studies at the University of Frankfurt."Prof Lucas Papademos", Goethe University Frankfurt Retrieved 12 November 2011. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:Greek educators Category:Greek economists Category:Living people Category:Prime ministers of Greece Category:Politicians from Athens
title: Lucas Papademos
